text: The Gambia Football Federation (GFF), formerly known as the Gambia Football Association (GFA), is the governing body of football in Gambia. It is in charge of the men's and the women's national teams. The association was founded in 1952. It became a member of CAF in 1966 and FIFA in 1968. The current president is Lamin Kaba Bajo since September 2014. == Other websites == * Official website * Gambia at FIFA site * Gambia at CAF site Category:1952 establishments Category:1950s establishments in Africa Category:Football governing bodies in Africa Category:Football in the Gambia
title: Gambia Football Federation
